intro: [WRONG START] Piper lanosibracteatum, commonly known as the wooly bract pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, or lanose, bracts that give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that matures to a dark purple color.
